page.title: 01Lochnagr's Northern Slopes
page.content: This block consists almost entirely of heather dominated rough mountain terrain. The upper hill slopes are boulder strewn and in some cases precipitous, while the lower slopes are more generally heathery with some area of wet grassland and eroded peat.The region is drained by the Lochnagar Burn, which runs underground for part of its upper reaches after leaving the Lochnagar Corrie Loch, and by other tributaries of the Gelder Burn. The highest point in the block is the summit of Lochnagar, on which there stands a viewpoint indicator erected by the Cairngorm Club in 1924. There is no human habitation in the area, although the Meikle Pap and the summit of Lochnagar are visited regularly by hillwakers and climbers, and there are few man made features other than the paths and tracks
